body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

The lifecycle `preStop` hook fails on container stop / exit because `/bin/sh` is not found in the driver registrar container image for some reason.

**Expected behavior:**

The lifecycle `preStop` to succeed and remove the csi driver sockets successfully.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

```
  Normal   Killing            7m36s                 kubelet, my-node1  Stopping container driver-registrar
  Normal   Killing            7m36s                 kubelet, my-node1  Stopping container liveness-prometheus
  Normal   Killing            7m36s                 kubelet, my-node1  Stopping container csi-rbdplugin
  Warning  FailedPreStopHook  7m35s                 kubelet, my-node1  Exec lifecycle hook ([/bin/sh -c rm -rf /registration/csi-rbdplugin /registration/csi-rbdplugin-reg.sock]) for Container "driver-registrar" in Pod "csi-rbdplugin-4j6w5_rook-ceph(82b9762f-672a-4def-b094-04ba03aeb086)" failed - error: command '/bin/sh -c rm -rf /registration/csi-rbdplugin /registration/csi-rbdplugin-reg.sock' exited with 126: , message: "OCI runtime exec failed: exec failed: container_linux.go:345: starting container process caused \"exec: \\\"/bin/sh\\\": stat /bin/sh: no such file or directory\": unknown\r\n"
  Warning  FailedKillPod      5m35s                 kubelet, my-node1  error killing pod: failed to "KillContainer" for "csi-rbdplugin" with KillContainerError: "rpc error: code = Unknown desc = operation timeout: context deadline exceeded"
  Warning  FailedSync         36s (x15 over 3m35s)  kubelet, my-node1  error determining status: rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded
```

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.15.0-70 generic
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Bare metal on-premise
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.1.7
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): v14.2.4
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.15.5
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): Kubernetes
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_WARN too few PGs per OSD` (should not be relevant here)
title: Ceph CSI Lifecycle Hook fails
